concise_definition: v. 喘气, 发怒; n. 怒气, 喘息声

definitions.explanation_en: To breathe noisily and forcefully, often due to anger, exertion, or frustration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因愤怒、劳累或沮丧而发出响亮而急促的呼吸声。
definitions.example_en: She huffed and puffed as she climbed the steep hill.
definitions.example_cn: 她一边喘着粗气，一边费力地爬着陡峭的山坡。

definitions.explanation_en: To express anger or annoyance, often by making a loud exhalation or acting in a sullen, dramatic way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过发出响亮的呼气声或表现出闷闷不乐、夸张的姿态来表达愤怒或不满。
definitions.example_en: He huffed out of the room after being criticized.
definitions.example_cn: 他被批评后气呼呼地冲出了房间。

definitions.explanation_en: A loud, forceful exhalation of breath, typically expressing irritation or anger.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种因恼怒或愤怒而发出的响亮而急促的呼气声。
definitions.example_en: She let out a loud huff when she saw the mess in the kitchen.
definitions.example_cn: 她看到厨房里一片狼藉时，重重地哼了一声。

definitions.explanation_en: A fit of anger or sullen mood, often accompanied by dramatic behavior.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一阵愤怒或闷闷不乐的情绪，常伴随夸张的行为表现。
definitions.example_en: He was in a huff all afternoon after the argument.
definitions.example_cn: 争吵之后，他整个下午都生着闷气。

comparison.analysis: “Puff” (轻吹/喷气) 通常指短促、轻柔或有控制的呼气，如吹蜡烛或吸烟时的喷气，语气较轻，不带强烈情绪。而 “huff” 强调愤怒或烦躁时的粗重、响亮的呼吸，情绪色彩更浓。
“Snort” (嗤之以鼻) 指通过鼻子用力呼气，常表示轻蔑或嘲笑，声音更尖锐、集中于鼻腔。而 “huff” 是通过嘴巴或整个呼吸道发出的粗重呼气，更侧重于情绪宣泄而非贬低他人。
“Sulk” (生闷气) 指沉默、阴郁地发怒，通常不伴随明显的声音或动作，是一种内敛的情绪反应。而 “huff” 是外显的、带有声音或戏剧性行为的愤怒表达，更外向、更激烈。
